query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
1 O Simon mago, o miseri seguaci 2 che le cose di Dio, che di bontate 3 deon essere spose, e voi rapaci
4 per oro e per argento avolterate, 5 or convien che per voi suoni la tromba, 6 però che ne la terza bolgia state.
query.result:
1 O Simon mage, O wretched followers 2 who the things of God, who of goodness 3 must be wives, and you rapacious
4 for gold and for silver you have turned away, 5 now it is fitting that for you the trumpet sounds, 6 since you are in the third bolgia.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
7 Già eravamo, a la seguente tomba, 8 montati de lo scoglio in quella parte 9 ch’a punto sovra mezzo ’l fosso piomba.
query.result: 7 Already we were, at the following tomb, 8 mounted from the rock in that part 9 that at a point over the middle the ditch falls.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
10 O somma sapïenza, quanta è l’arte 11 che mostri in cielo, in terra e nel mal mondo, 12 e quanto giusto tua virtù comparte!
13 Io vidi per le coste e per lo fondo 14 piena la pietra livida di fóri, 15 d’un largo tutti e ciascun era tondo.
query.result:
10 O supreme wisdom, how great is the art 11 that you show in heaven, on earth and in the bad world, 12 and how just your virtue shares!
13 I saw through the coasts and through the depth 14 the stone full, livid with fires, 15 of a broad all and each was round.

16 They did not seem to me less ample nor larger 17 than those that are in my beautiful Saint John, 18 made for the place of the baptizers;
19 the one of which, still not many years, 20 I break for one who inside was drowning: 21 and this may be the seal that every man shatters.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.

query.result: 22 Out of the mouth each one was covering 23 of a sinner the feet and of the legs 24 up to the thigh, and the other inside was

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
25 Le piante erano a tutti accese intrambe; 26 per che sì forte guizzavan le giunte, 27 che spezzate averien ritorte e strambe.

Please translate each line literally into English.
28 Qual suole il fiammeggiar de le cose unte 29 muoversi pur su per la strema buccia, 30 tal era lì dai calcagni a le punte.
query.result: 28 As the flaming of oily things usually does 29 moves itself even up through the thin skin, 30 such it was there from the heels to the tips

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
31 «Chi è colui, maestro, che si cruccia 32 guizzando più che li altri suoi consorti», 33 diss’ io, «e cui più roggia fiamma succia?».
query.result: 31 Who is that one, master, who twists himself 32 leaping more than his other companions, 33 I said, “and to whom does the flame suck more?”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
34 Ed elli a me: «Se tu vuo’ ch’i’ ti porti 35 là giù per quella ripa che più giace, 36 da lui saprai di sé e de’ suoi torti».
query.result: 34 And he to me: “If you want that I carry you 35 down there through that bank which lies more, 36 from him you will know of himself and of his wrongs.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
37 E io: «Tanto m’è bel, quanto a te piace: 38 tu se’ segnore, e sai ch’i’ non mi parto 39 dal tuo volere, e sai quel che si tace».
query.result: 37 And I: “It is as beautiful to me as it pleases you: 38 you are lord, and you know that I do not depart 39 from your will, and you know what is kept silent.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
40 Allor venimmo in su l’argine quarto; 41 volgemmo e discendemmo a mano stanca 42 là giù nel fondo foracchiato e arto.

Please translate each line literally into English.
43 Lo buon maestro ancor de la sua anca 44 non mi dipuose, sì mi giunse al rotto 45 di quel che si piangeva con la zanca.
query.result: 43 The good master still from his hip 44 did not lay me down, so it came to me at the broken 45 of that which was wept with the hind leg

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
46 «O qual che se’ che ’l di sù tien di sotto, 47 anima trista come pal commessa», 48 comincia’ io a dir, «se puoi, fa motto».
query.result: 46 O you who are that who the day above holds from below, 47 sad soul like a pledged pole, 48 I began to say, “if you can, make a motto.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
49 Io stava come ’l frate che confessa 50 lo perfido assessin, che, poi ch’è fitto, 51 richiama lui per che la morte cessa.
query.result: 49 I stood like the brother who confesses 50 the perfidious assassin, who, since he is dense, 51 he summons him so that death ceases

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
52 Ed el gridò: «Se’ tu già costì ritto, 53 se’ tu già costì ritto, Bonifazio? 54 Di parecchi anni mi mentì lo scritto.
query.result: 52 And he shouted: “If you are already thus straight, 53 if you are already thus straight, Bonifazio? 54 The writing lied to me of several years.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
55 Se’ tu sì tosto di quell’ aver sazio 56 per lo qual non temesti tòrre a ’nganno 57 la bella donna, e poi di farne strazio?».
query.result: 55 Are you so swift to have that satisfied 56 for which you did not fear to turn to deceit 57 the beautiful woman, and then to make her anguish?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
58 Tal mi fec’ io, quai son color che stanno, 59 per non intender ciò ch’è lor risposto, 60 quasi scornati, e risponder non sanno.
query.result: 58 Such I made myself, those are the ones who stand, 59 in order not to understand that which is their reply, 60 almost scorned, and they do not know how to answer.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
61 Allor Virgilio disse: «Dilli tosto: 62 “Non son colui, non son colui che credi”»; 63 e io rispuosi come a me fu imposto.

Please translate each line literally into English.
64 Per che lo spirto tutti storse i piedi; 65 poi, sospirando e con voce di pianto, 66 mi disse: «Dunque che a me richiedi?
67 Se di saper ch’i’ sia ti cal cotanto, 68 che tu abbi però la ripa corsa, 69 sappi ch’i’ fui vestito del gran manto;
70 e veramente fui figliuol de l’orsa, 71 cupido sì per avanzar li orsatti, 72 che sù l’avere e qui me misi in borsa.

Please translate each line literally into English.
73 Di sotto al capo mio son li altri tratti 74 che precedetter me simoneggiando, 75 per le fessure de la pietra piatti.
query.result: 73 Below my head are the other strokes 74 that preceded me simoneggiando, 75 through the cracks of the stone flat

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.

query.result: 76 There down I will fall also when 77 will come he who I believed that you were, 78 then that I made the immediate I ask.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
79 Ma più è ’l tempo già che i piè mi cossi 80 e ch’i’ son stato così sottosopra, 81 ch’el non starà piantato coi piè rossi:
82 ché dopo lui verrà di più laida opra, 83 di ver’ ponente, un pastor sanza legge, 84 tal che convien che lui e me ricuopra.
query.result:
79 But already more is the time that the feet beat me 80 and that I have been thus upside‑down, 81 that he will not stand planted with red feet:
82 because after him will come more loathsome work, 83 of true west, a shepherd without law, 84 such that it is fitting that he and I be covered.

85 Nuovo Iasón sarà, di cui si legge 86 ne’ Maccabei; e come a quel fu molle 87 suo re, così fia lui chi Francia regge».

query.result: 94 Neither Pier nor the others took from Matia 95 gold or silver, when it was obtained 96 to the place that lost the wicked soul

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
97 Però ti sta, ché tu se’ ben punito; 98 e guarda ben la mal tolta moneta 99 ch’esser ti fece contra Carlo ardito.

Please translate each line literally into English.
100 E se non fosse ch’ancor lo mi vieta 101 la reverenza de le somme chiavi 102 che tu tenesti ne la vita lieta,
103 io userei parole ancor più gravi; 104 ché la vostra avarizia il mondo attrista, 105 calcando i buoni e sollevando i pravi.
query.result:
100 And if it were not that it still forbids me 101 the reverence of the sum keys 102 that you held in the happy life,
103 I would use words even more grave; 104 because your avarice makes the world sad, 105 treading on the good and raising the wicked.

106 The Evangelist notices your shepherd, 107 when she who sits above the waters 108 to prostitute with the kings was seen to him;
109 the one who was born with the seven heads, 110 and from the ten horns had argument, 111 until virtue pleased her husband.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
112 Fatto v’avete dio d’oro e d’argento; 113 e che altro è da voi a l’idolatre, 114 se non ch’elli uno, e voi ne orate cento?
115 Ahi, Costantin, di quanto mal fu matre, 116 non la tua conversion, ma quella dote 117 che da te prese il primo ricco patre!».
query.result:
112 Made you have a god of gold and of silver; 113 and what else is from you to the idolater, 114 if not that they are one, and you pray a hundred?
115 Ah, Constantine, of how much evil was mother, 116 not your conversion, but that dowry 117 that from you took the first rich father!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
118 E mentr’ io li cantava cotai note, 119 o ira o coscïenza che ’l mordesse, 120 forte spingava con ambo le piote.
query.result: 118 And while I sang them such nights, 119 or wrath or conscience that would bite it, 120 strongly pushed with both feet.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
121 I’ credo ben ch’al mio duca piacesse, 122 con sì contenta labbia sempre attese 123 lo suon de le parole vere espresse.
query.result: 121 I truly believe that it pleased my duke, 122 with such a contented lip always awaiting, 123 the sound of the true words expressed.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
124 Però con ambo le braccia mi prese; 125 e poi che tutto su mi s’ebbe al petto, 126 rimontò per la via onde discese.

Please translate each line literally into English.
127 Né si stancò d’avermi a sé distretto, 128 sì men portò sovra ’l colmo de l’arco 129 che dal quarto al quinto argine è tragetto.
query.result: 127 Nor did he tire of having me to himself set apart, 128 so less he carried over the summit of the arch, 129 that from the fourth to the fifth bank is drawn.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
130 Quivi soavemente spuose il carco, 131 soave per lo scoglio sconcio ed erto 132 che sarebbe a le capre duro varco.
query.result: 130 Quivi soavemente spuose il carco, → There gently spuose the carco, 131 soave per lo scoglio sconcio ed erto → gentle over the rude and steep rock, 132 che sarebbe a le capre duro varco. → that would be a hard crossing for the goats.

query.result: 133 Then another valley was revealed to me.
